title: Epilogue

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Congratulations, Seliph! You’ve endured so much so well to make it this far.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Thank you, Lewyn, but our victory means precious little while our world still lies in ruins. Where do we begin from there?

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: There’s only one way to rebuild all the sacred lands. Everyone needs to come together and share the work among you. And for that, you’ll need a good leader. The crusaders’ heirs will be returning home to assume their rightful thrones. And with the proper leadership, they can pool their strengths again to build a new world, one where all can live in happiness.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: A new world, you say…

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Yeah, Seliph.. A new world. And your role is the most crucial of all. You’ll remain here in Belhalla, and you’ll guide the rise of this new world as the King of Grannvale.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Hold on. I’M to be the king?!

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Mm-hmm. After all that’s happened, you and Julia are the last living heirs of the blood of Grannvale’s kings. The two of you have inherited the last will of all who lost their lives on this path. These souls watch over you, even now. You mustn’t forget the light for which they strove.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mm… I understand, Lewyn. So long as I have the power, I’ll do all I can.

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Now, Julia. What do you say?

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.line: I agree, of course. I wish to aid Lord Seliph… No, my lord brother, every step of the way. I know this path will be a gruelling one, but that’s all the more reason to give it my all…

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.line: Lady Lover, you’ll do all you can to aid my brother as well, won’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Yes, and gladly so! But, er… Lady Julia, what about…

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.line: I… I must atone for the fate of Lord Sigurd… I know that’s what my mother, Lady Deirdre, would wish of me…

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Mm-hmm. You and Julia were the last surviving heirs of the blood of Grannvale’s kings. But we lost Julia in today’s battle…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Julia… I swore I would always protect her… And I failed. Her death is my fault…

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Whatever you do, you can’t let Julia’s death be in vain, Seliph. She bore the weight of her awful fate on her shoulders, but still she never gave up. I guess she got that from her mother in a way. Deirdre, too, was always haunted by her mistakes and failures. I’m sure you understand, Seliph, that you inherited the last will on all those who lost their lives on this path. These souls watch over you, even now. You mustn’t forget the light for which they strove.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Of course… I understand, Lewyn. I’ll guide this world with all I have, so long as I draw breath. In Julia’s name…

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Well, then! Looks like everyone is making their way here from the front lines. Seliph, this’ll be your first task as king. I’m sure they’d all love some words of thanks.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Well, that’s it. I’m going home, Seliph. I’ve left the Isaachian people to wait long enough.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I doubt I could ever thank you enough for all you’ve done for me, Shannan. All my life, you’ve been here to protect me at every turn. I owe you so dearly.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Your father, Lord Sigurd, was always there for me when I was a child, as was the Lady Deirdre. But when we lost Lady Deirdre, I couldn’t do a thing to stop it… I failed Lord Sigurd. Even now, I’ll never forget that day.... You don’t owe me a thing, Seliph. Not when I’ve caused you so much pain…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: No, Shannan. If it weren’t for you and the people of Isaach, I wouldn’t be here today. To me, Isaach will always be home. Nothing will ever change that.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: I’m sure everyone back in Isaach will be heartened to hear such kind words.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Come on, Shannan. Lord Seliph is the king of Grannvale-to-be yet here you are, talking to him as if he’s but your younger brother.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Lover… Yeah, I suppose you’re right. I ought to put on proper airs! “King Seliph”.... No, that’s not quite right. Perhaps “Your Imperial Majesty, the King” then?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I’m sorry… I shouldn’t have said that. Bidding farewell to Lord Seliph must be hard enough without my commentary! My apologies, to both of you. I shouldn’t have said something so crass…

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Heh, it’s fine. You did speak honestly, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Shannan…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: C’mon, Shannan! This is Grannvale’s new king you’re talking to here. I’m not sure you should be this brotherly to him.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Lover… Yeah, I suppose you’re right. I ought to put on proper airs! “King Seliph”.... No, that’s not quite right. Perhaps “Your Imperial Majesty, the King” then?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Oh! I didn’t mean to anger you, Shannan. You’re right… Parting ways like this has to be so painful for you already. I’m really sorry. That was just horrid of me.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: Heh, it’s fine. You did speak honestly, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Shannan…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I’ve always thought of you as a brother, Shannan. I pray we never forget that bond.

dialogue.speaker: Shannan
dialogue.line: My blade will always be yours, King Seliph. I’ll never forget that so long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Lord Seliph, I’m headed home with the king. I’ve got a country to help King Shannan rebuild. That’s all I really want.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, of course, Scáthach. I know King Shannan will depend on your support. And I know your mother, Lady Ayra, would love nothing more than for you to devote your life to the Isaachian people.

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: I’ve never seen you so happy, Scáthach. But then again, knowing we’re finally about to go home, I feel the same way!

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Oh, you too? I almost forgot. We both grew up in Isaach, didn’t we?

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: Mm…

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: We’re going back together, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: Yes… I’ve always hoped we would.

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Whew! I’m relieved to hear you say it.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I’ve never seen you this happy, Scáthach! It must be nice to finally be going home!

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: It’s only natural, Lover. I did spend most of my life there, after all!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: So, er…

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Yeah...?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Say, Scáthach… Is it okay if I come with you?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: What, you want to come? To Isaach? With me?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I do…

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Wow… Thanks, Lover!

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: I’m heading home now, King Seliph. With King Shannan’s death, it’s up to me to protect Isaach in his place.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, of course, Scáthach. You’re next in line for the Isaachian throne, are you not? I know you’ll take good care of the people.

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Still glum, huh, Scáthach… Lord Shannan’s death is really hurting you…

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh… You think I can help you at all by staying by your side?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Yep! If that’s what you want, Lover…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You still look so sad, Scáthach. Lord Shannan’s death still weighs heavily on you, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Perhaps… Do you think having me around will do you any good?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: If that’s what you want, Scáthach, then I am…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You look awfully sad, Scáthach… Lord Shannan’s death is still troubling you, right?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Larcei and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh… Do you think having me by your side will do you any good?

dialogue.speaker: Scáthach
dialogue.line: Huh? ...You’re not serious, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: If you want me there, Scáthach, then I am…

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: I’m going home with Scáthach, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care....

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: I’m going home with the king, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You still feel lonesome, yes? After what happened to Scáthach, I mean… I pray you’ll still work your hardest for Isaach.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: I know, I know! I’m fine. I… I’m so proud of my brother.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care....

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: I’m going home, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Larcei, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Lover.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: No, sir. It’s my fault that he’s… I failed to protect him. I’ll never forget the time we had together, no matter what…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Larcei… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Okay, Lord Seliph, I’m headed home with King Shannan. I’ve got a country to help them rebuild. That’s all I really want.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, of course, Rodolbahn. I know he’ll depend on your support. I pray your combined might will bring peace to the people of Isaach.

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: I’ve never seen you so happy, Rodolbahn. But then again, knowing we’re finally about to go home, I feel the same way!

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Oh, you too? I almost forgot. We both grew up in Isaach, didn’t we?

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: Mm…

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: We’re going back together, right?

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: Yes… I’ve always hoped we would.

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Whew! I’m relieved to hear you say it.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I’ve never seen you this happy, Rodolbahn! It must be nice to finally be going home!

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: It’s only natural, Lover. I did spend most of my life there, after all!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: So, er…

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Yeah...?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Say, Rodolbahn… Is it okay if I come with you?

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: What, you want to come? To Isaach? With me?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I do…

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Wow… Thanks, Lover!

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Okay, Lord Seliph, I’m headed home. Now that King Shannan’s dead, Isaach needs someone like me to watch over it in his place.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, of course, Rodolbahn. King Shannan’s demise brought an end to the royal Isaachian bloodline, yes? I promise you Grannvale will do all it can to aid you, but the welfare and defense of Isaach will depend on you.

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. My life is theirs!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Still glum, huh, Rodolbahn… Lord Shannan’s death is really hurting you…

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Radney and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh… You think I can help you at all by staying by your side?

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Yep! If that’s what you want, Lover…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You still look so sad, Rodolbahn. Lord Shannan’s death still weighs heavily on you, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: There’s no way it couldn’t. He was the closest thing that Radney and I ever had to a father. I’ll never forgive myself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Perhaps… Do you think having me around will do you any good?

dialogue.speaker: Rodolbahn
dialogue.line: Huh… You’re not serious, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: If that’s what you want, Rodolbahn, then I am…

dialogue.speaker: Radney
dialogue.line: I’m going home with Rodolbahn, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

dialogue.speaker: Radney
dialogue.line: I’m going home with the king, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Radney, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Rodolbahn.

dialogue.speaker: Radney
dialogue.line: No, sir. I believe he died a happy man. I… I’m proud of him, I guess…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

dialogue.speaker: Radney
dialogue.line: I’m going home, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Radney, I… I beg your forgiveness for what happened to Lover.

dialogue.speaker: Radney
dialogue.line: No, sir. It’s my fault that he’s… I failed to protect him. I’ll never forget the time we had together, no matter what…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Radney… I know we’ll meet again someday. Take care…

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Lord Seliph…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You’re bound for Isaach as well, Dimna?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: I am. Thanks for everything, sir.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Oh, no. It is I who owes you thanks! Thank you, Dimna.

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Take care of yourself, sir!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Going back to Isaach, Dimna?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah, that’s the plan…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh… Really?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah… And I really want you to come with me, Lover.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Wait, really?! You REALLY want me to take you along?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah! I mean, if you want to come, of course.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Are you going back to Isaach, Dimna?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah, that’s the plan…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Hm… Is that so…

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah… And I really want you to come with me, Lover.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Eh? Really?! You… You really want me with you…

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah! I mean, if you want to come, of course.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: You’re going back to Isaach, right, Dimna?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Yeah, that’s the plan… Are you?

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: I, er… I’m not sure I should…

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: ...I want to go home with you, Larcei.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Er, why?

dialogue.speaker: Dimna
dialogue.line: Because I love you, silly!

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Wh- You can’t just say this stuff out loud, you moron! Eh, doesn’t matter. We’ll go home… together.

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mana… So even you…

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Isaach is the only place I could ever call home. I need to work with Dimna and the others to restore Isaach.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mana…

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mana…. I’m so, so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Why?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I let Lover die… I couldn’t do a thing to save him. But he still keeps watch over you, even now… I know it.

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Y-yes, Lord Seliph…

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Thank you so much for all you’ve done for me, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mana… So even you…

dialogue.speaker: Mana
dialogue.line: Isaach is the only place I could ever call home. I know it’ll be lonesome, but there’s nothing I can do now...

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I’m so sorry, Mana...

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: Well, it’s time to say goodbye. Best of luck!

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: I couldn’t possibly thank you enough for everything, Lord Seliph. I’ll be departing for Leonster shortly. The Thracian peninsula has suffered from war long enough, and it’s high time that we rebuilt.

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: I know my sister, Altena, wishes dearly for a restored Thracia as well.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Indeed. This war has lain waste upon Thracia, and I cannot imagine the burden laid upon you, the king-to-be of a united peninsula… I pray that you give it your best, no matter what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: I will. You take care as well, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Long ago, our fathers Sigurd and Quan were bound by the closest of friendships, sharing their deaths as they did their lives. Prince Leif, I’d love nothing more than for us to follow their example and remain lifelong friends.

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: As do I, Lord Seliph!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You’re about to leave, aren’t you, Leif?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: Do you wish to accompany me, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh? Would that really be alright with you?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: But of course! All I want is to have you and your might by my side.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Th-thank you!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: So you’re off, Leif?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: Do you wish to accompany me, Lover?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh? You’d be fine with me coming!?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: But of course! All I want is to have you and your might by my side.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Hwaaah! Thank you, Leif!

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Leif… You’re off soon, aren’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: Do you want to accompany me, Larcei?

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Huh? You really want me to come?

dialogue.speaker: Leif
dialogue.line: But of course!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: So you’re destined for Thracia as well, Princess Altena…

dialogue.speaker: Altena
dialogue.line: I am, sir. I’ve got to help the new king in his quest to give rise to a unified Thracia… At the very least, I ought to atone for the legacy of my adopted family… Travant and Arion.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: How wonderful it would be, if Arion were to work together with you…

dialogue.speaker: Altena
dialogue.line: I… I don’t believe that could happen for the time being, sir. But perhaps someday, he’ll feel the time is right…

dialogue.speaker: Finn
dialogue.line: I shall be bound for home as well, milord. I wish you the best of health.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Sir Finn, you’ve come to my family’s aid time and again, and for twenty years played a crucial part in both my cause and Father’s. I couldn’t possibly thank you enough…

dialogue.speaker: Finn
dialogue.line: No, I am a servant of House Leonster. As a knight, I have but followed where my lieges have led. No more, no less.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Thracia is in your hands, Sir Finn. I hope you’ll assist Prince Leif in granting Thracia its hard-won peace.

dialogue.speaker: Finn
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. A peaceful Thracia was my Lord Quan’s lifelong dream as well, and I’ll do all that I can to bring that dream to life.

dialogue.speaker: Hannibal
dialogue.line: Many thanks, King Seliph! I shall excuse myself now.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Are you headed for Thracia as well, General Hannibal?

dialogue.speaker: Hannibal
dialogue.line: Indeed. Thracia yet hangs in the balance, and the people await my return.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Who better to lead the reconstruction of Thracia than a mighty war hero? Do your best for the youths of Thracia.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, Cairpre. I presume you’ll be departing with the general?

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: I am, sir. I will be going with Papa to work to rebuild Thracia.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I see… You know, Cairpre, I’ve seldom seen anyone as happy as you are now. I confess I’m a bit envious!

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: I’m so proud of Papa, sir. I may just be adopted, but I’m still the son of the great General Hannibal!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Aww, how adorable. Good thing you’ve now got me to be like a big sister for you!

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Hee hee! You really are still just a kid! Relax, it’ll all make total sense one day.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You really are the cutest, Cairpre. And from now on, you’ll have me around to be your older sister!

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You really are still a child. Don’t worry. Someday you’ll understand everything.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You’re adorable, Cairpre, y’know that? I guess from now on, you’ll need me to look after you like a big sister should.

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Eh, I guess you’re still just a kid. Don’t worry, you’ll get it someday.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: C’mon, Cairpre. Cheer up! You’re a man now, right? It’ll all work out. I’ve got your back from now on.

dialogue.speaker: Cairpre
dialogue.line: Huh, Lover? ...What exactly are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Eh, I guess you’re still just a kid. Don’t worry, you’ll get it someday.

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: I’m going home as well, Seliph. I owe you real big.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You’re a Connaught native, yes?

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Yeah. My folks were hunters workin’ in Connaught. They were pretty poor, then they got caught up in the war and got killed.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Is that so…

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Guess that’s why I hate kings and nobles. Well, most of em. I mean, you’re actually alright, Seliph. Good luck out there, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Thank you, Asaello.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You’re sad, aren’t you, Asaello? Sad that you need to part with Lord Seliph…

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: W-what? No, not even close!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: And being with me wouldn’t help? You’d still be lonely?

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: No, that’s not it at all! You being here means so much to me. You could never not be a help!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Heh… Oh, Asaello…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: You’re sad, aren’t you, Asaello? Sad that you need to part with Lord Seliph…

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: W-what? No, not even close!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: And being with me wouldn’t help? Even then you’d still be lonely?

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: No, that’s not it at all! You being here means so much to me. You could never not be a help!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Asaello, I know it’s going to be hard for you to leave Seliph. But don’t worry! I’ll always be here for you!

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Lover… Thanks, I guess. Having you around is better than nobody.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Tee hee! You’re so cute when you’re shy! That’s why I like you.

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Oh, come on, you don’t have to put that in words.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Asaello… Leaving Seliph now’s gotta be pretty painful, huh? I know you’ll tough it out.

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: I know that, Larcei. I’m not weak.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: What’s with the attitude? I’m just worried about you!

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Don’t worry about me. I told you, I’m not weak. You couldn’t possibly understand how I feel!

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Fine, then. I’m leaving you. You can go home by yourself!

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Hold on, I didn’t mean it… I’m sorry! Just don’t leave me!

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Hmph…

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Larcei… Come on. I need you.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Okay, but I need you to promise one thing: don’t talk back to me ever again.

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: F-Fine… I promise…

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Then all is forgiven. Let’s go.

dialogue.speaker: Asaello
dialogue.line: Sigh… Can’t live with her, can’t live without her…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And you as well, Daisy?

dialogue.speaker: Daisy
dialogue.line: Yep. No offense, but I can’t say I want to sit around here twiddling my thumbs. Besides, my brother’ll need my help!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Remember, there’s plenty to keep you busy in Connaught which doesn’t involve stealing.

dialogue.speaker: Daisy
dialogue.line: Oh! How could you SAY that, sir?! I gave the thief thing up ages ago!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Heh, my apologies. Well, Daisy, take care.

dialogue.speaker: Daisy
dialogue.line: You too, sir…

dialogue.speaker: Lewyn
dialogue.line: The job awaiting you, the heroes of Thracia, certainly won’t be easy. It’s up to you to unite two peoples divided by bitter hatred, and build for them all a new, powerful land.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: Seliph… I dearly owe you for all you’ve done to assist me. I’ll never forget so long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Oh, no, Prince Ares. The joy chancing upon you brought is thanks enough! It was such an honor to meet the son of my father’s dearest friend. As tragic as their lives were, their faith in each other was unshakable to the very end. Our fathers, Prince Ares, were united by a single dream that their deaths left unfulfilled. Let us fulfill their dream where they cannot. Let the two of us, hand in hand, guide all Jugdral towards bringing the dream to life.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: Well spoken, King Seliph! My father so dearly wished to see his beloved Agustria united in a lasting peace. In the name of his dying wish, I’ll carve up for Agustria a new, prosperous future.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: But my might alone shall not suffice. To this end, my dearest Lover, I pray I’ll have your strength ever by my side.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Yep, of course! I’m gonna do everything I can to help rebuild Agustria as well. Let’s all work together to build an Agustria where anyone can live happily.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: Indeed! So long as you remain, I know I’ll never give up.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: But my might alone shall not suffice. To this end, my dearest Lover, I pray I’ll have your strength ever by my side.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: But of course. I’ll dedicate my life to helping restore Agustria as well. All these years of war have burnt deep scars in Agustria. All I want is to ensure all Agustrians can live peaceful lives.

dialogue.speaker: Ares
dialogue.line: Indeed! So long as you remain, I know I’ll never give up.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And what of you, Lene…

dialogue.speaker: Lene
dialogue.line: I don’t exactly have a home to go to, so I thought I’d give Agustria a try.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I see… Don’t worry too much. Somebody wonderful, I know, will be graced with your charm one day, Lene.

dialogue.speaker: Lene
dialogue.line: Hee hee… Oh, Lord Seliph! I know you’re just trying to perk me up. But it’s okay! I’ve always got dancing… I’ve been alone my whole life. Staying alone for the rest of it won’t be that bad.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Lene…

dialogue.speaker: Dermott
dialogue.line: I’m going with Prince Ares to Agustria, Lord Seliph. I’ll lend the prince my strength and help rebuild the country.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Dermott? Ah, of course. Your mother was a noblewoman of Nordion, yes?

dialogue.speaker: Dermott
dialogue.line: Lord Eldigan’s sister, Lachesis, to be exact, sir. Nobody was closer to him than she was. I’ll give my entire life to fulfilling the last wishes of my mother and Eldigan, and to creating a united Agustria.

dialogue.speaker: Nanna
dialogue.line: Lord Seliph, I’m going to Agustria with my brother.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I admit this is a surprise, Nanna. I assumed you would go to Leonster…

dialogue.speaker: Nanna
dialogue.line: I know… But my work in Leonster’s done. I’ve got no regrets…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I see… Take care, Nanna. You deserve nothing but happiness.

dialogue.speaker: Nanna
dialogue.line: And you too, Lord Seliph...

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: My apologies, Tristan, but I’d like for you to go to Agustria. Agustria is still in the midst of an agonizing war, and Prince Ares will need your help to save it.

dialogue.speaker: Tristan
dialogue.line: No, sir, I’m glad you asked. Agustria’s my home, and it’s an honor to be allowed to return there by my king!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And of course, Lover, you may go with Tristan. I’d hate to part the two of you even briefly.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Huh? You know about us, sir?! Kyaaaah! How embarrassing!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Heh… It isn’t exactly hard to see, Lover. I wish you two naught but happiness.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Thanks so much, Lord Seliph!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And of course, Lover, you may go with Tristan. I’d hate to part the two of you even briefly.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Hm? You already know about us, Lord Seliph?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: It isn’t exactly hard to see, Lover. I wish you two naught but happiness.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Thank you so much, Lord Seliph!

dialogue.speaker: Jeanne
dialogue.line: Lord Seliph, I’m going to Agustria with my brother.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I admit this is a surprise, Jeanne. I assumed you would go to Leonster…

dialogue.speaker: Jeanne
dialogue.line: I know… But my work in Leonster’s done. I’ve got no regrets…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I see… Take care, Jeanne. You deserve nothing but happiness.

dialogue.speaker: Jeanne
dialogue.line: And you too, Lord Seliph...

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I’ll be leaving for Verdane, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Verdane, you say? Ah, of course. Your father was Prince Jamke. I understand. From what I’ve heard, Verdane has been naught but ruins dominated by brigand clans, ever since the royal family collapsed.

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: So I’ve heard, sir. I don’t know how much good I can do by myself, but I have to try. Those bandits have run rampant long enough.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Indeed! Verdane was my mother’s home, and my parents first met there as well. Jamke’s son, I entrust this task to you. Do all you can to save Verdane’s people.

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: Yes, Lord Seliph!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I’m ready to go when you are, Jamke’s son!

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I don’t think so, Lover. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Oh, no, I don’t think so! I’m going with you, and just try and stop me!

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I’m sorry, Lover… You’re right. We’ll both save Verdane, together.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Wait up, Jamke’s son! I’m coming, too!

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I don’t think so, Larcei. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: You’re joking, right? I’m Larcei of Isaach, and I’m just as much of a warrior as you are! I don’t care how much you want to. I’m not gonna let you go alone!

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: Hahaha… Yeah, you’re right. You’ll never have anything to fear from simple bandits, will you? Sorry about that. We’ll go together! Having you by my side’s all the courage I need!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: And I’ll be right by your side, Jamke’s son.

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I don’t think so, Lover. It’ll be far too dangerous to take you along. Don’t worry. I’ll be back for you, no matter what, once it’s all over.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: But I can’t stand to sit back and wait for a return which may never come… What happens if you leave me behind and I never get to see you again…? I don’t want our love to end the same way Lord Sigurd’s and Lady Deirdre’s did!

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Son
dialogue.line: I’m sorry, Lover… You’re right. We’ll both save Verdane, together.

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Daughter
dialogue.line: I’ll be going to Verdane with Jamke’s son as well, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You will, Jamke’s daughter?

dialogue.speaker: Jamke’S Daughter
dialogue.line: Yes. I want to help him restore our father’s beloved kingdom. There won’t be a single bandit left in Verdane once we’re through!

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: Well, Lord Seliph, I’m off to Jungby.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mm. Knowing Jungby is in your most capable hands will put my mind at ease.

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: ...I admit, sir, I couldn’t have seen all this coming in a thousand years. But finding out that my mom was Jungby’s Lady Bridget helped me find myself a purpose in life, and I know now what needs to be done. On this blessed bow of mine, Lord Seliph, I swear I’ll be with you every step of the way!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Don’t forget what you swore to me!

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: Huh? What did I promise you again?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Oh, come on… You ALREADY forgot?!

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: Kidding, kidding! It was a joke! Sorry… Wow, that’s a terrifying look you’re giving me.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: How was I supposed to know you’re joking?!

dialogue.line: So what about what you swore to me?

dialogue.speaker: Larcei
dialogue.line: Can you blame me for not being sure?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: And what about what you swore to me?

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: Huh? What did I promise you again?

dialogue.speaker: Lover

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: There’s a good reason I wasn’t sure!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And you as well, Patty?

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: Yep. No offense, but I can’t say I want to sit around her twiddling my thumbs. Besides, my brother’ll need my help!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Once you’ve settled in, there’ll surely be no shortage of tasks to keep you busy. But I assure you, none of it will involve theft. A noble has no place robbing others.

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: Oh! How could you SAY that, sir?! I gave the thief thing up ages ago!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Heh, my apologies. Well, Patty, take care.

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: You too, sir…

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: I’m off to Jungby now, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Ah, of course. You’re the heir to Jungby. ...Will you be okay?

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: Huh? Why, Lord Seliph, you’re not saying you think I’m nervous about this, are you?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Er, no. That isn’t what I meant! I just-

dialogue.speaker: Patty
dialogue.line: I’ll be just fine, sir. I’m the daughter of the great Lady Bridget, after all! Sure, I don’t look the part, but when the going needs doing, I’ll go and do it! Just watch me go, sir!

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: Well, Lord Seliph, I’m off to Jungby.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mm. Knowing Jungby is in your most capable hands will put my mind at ease.

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: Jungby should’ve gone to Lady Bridget’s kids, but there’s not much choice now. I’ll do everything to restore Jungby where my mother, Aideen, couldn’t. And of course, Lord Seliph, I’ll promise that you, Grannvale’s new king, will always have my loyalty.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Don’t forget your promise to me!

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: I haven’t, of course!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Just checking!

dialogue.speaker: Faval
dialogue.line: Lover, you’re kinda scaring me here.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Oh, that’s just mean! And if you say much more of it, I don’t know WHAT I’ll do! Heh heh heh…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: And what of your promise to me?

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: I haven’t forgotten, of course!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Good. I thought you wouldn’t, Lester.

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: Lover, you’re kinda scaring me here.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Heh heh… Am I now?

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: I’m going back to Jungby as well, sir.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mm. I know Jungby will need your might in the years to come, as will I.

dialogue.speaker: Lester
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. I want to help my cousin, just as my mother once helped my aunt, and I hope I can for the rest of my life.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And you as well, Lover. You’re as close as him as they come, aren’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Yep! I guess this means we’ll be around to visit you quite a bit, sir!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And you as well, Lover. You’re as close as him as they come, aren’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: So I am, Lord Seliph. I’m glad we get the chance to keep working with you.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Lana… My apologies…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I know you’re mad at me, Lana. Lester’s told me as much.

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: That’s because you’ve… No, it’s fine. I’ll be fine. I’m going home to Jungby now. Farewell, Lord Seliph…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Lana….

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Lana… You’ll be inheriting the Jungby throne, will you not?

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: I will… I’ll admit I never even thought Jungby’s rule would be left to me. But… I’ll get to stay by your side and help you… And I’m so glad I can.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: We’ve always been together, haven’t we, Lana? ...Fate is an odd thing, I suppose.

dialogue.speaker: Lana
dialogue.line: It truly is…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Headed for Freege, are you, Arthur?

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. Reptor and Blume’s crimes are beyond forgiveness, but Freege’s citizens can’t be blamed for their liege’s actions. I’ve got a duty to fill my mother’s shoes and guide the people where she no longer can.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: If anyone can do it, Arthur, it’ll be you. I’m glad you see peace is never born of hatred. I pray we’ll always be friends.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.line: Yes, sir!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: C’mon, Arthur, let’s go already! I’ve never been this bored in my life.

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.line: Heh. Thought you’d say that, Lover. Okay, let’s get going.

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Bye-bye, Lord Seliph! We’ll see you later…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I think you’ve chatted long enough, Arthur. Lord Seliph has work to do as well, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.line: Yeah, you’re right, Lover. Shall we head off, then?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Well, by your leave, Lord Seliph. Take care of yourself…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I think you’ve chatted long enough, Arthur. Lord Seliph has work to do as well, you know!

dialogue.speaker: Arthur
dialogue.line: Yeah, you’re right, Lover. Shall we head off, then?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: We’ll be leaving now, Lord Seliph. Take care of yourself…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: And you’ll be accompanying Arthur, Tine?

dialogue.speaker: Tine
dialogue.line: I am. All I want is to be of help to my brother.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You two are awfully close, aren’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Tine
dialogue.line: Mm, we are. I couldn’t possibly ask for a better brother…

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: You’re Freege’s heir, are you not, Tine? I’m sorry. I know returning to Freege couldn’t possibly be easy for you…

dialogue.speaker: Tine
dialogue.line: No, it won’t… But for Mother’s sake, I mustn’t run away. I hope I’ll have your help in this as well, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: But of course. We’ll be with you every step of the way.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Headed for Freege, are you, Amid?

dialogue.speaker: Amid
dialogue.line: Yes, sir. Reptor and Blume’s crimes are beyond forgiveness, but Freege’s citizens can’t be blamed for their liege’s actions. I’ve got a duty to fill my mother’s shoes and guide the people where she no longer can.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: If anyone can do it, Amid, it’ll be you. I’m glad you see peace is never born of hatred. I pray we’ll always be friends.

dialogue.speaker: Amid

dialogue.speaker: Amid
dialogue.line: Heh. Thought you’d say that, Lover. Okay, let’s get going.

dialogue.speaker: Lover

dialogue.speaker: Linda
dialogue.line: Mm, we are. I couldn’t possibly ask for a better brother…

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: I’m going to Dozel, Lord Seliph.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Your father was Lord Lex, correct? I’m sure the people of Dozel eagerly await your return, Lex’s son.

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: The likes of Langbalt and Dannan have tormented the people and stained House Dozel’s good name for too long. Now that my father is gone, it falls to me to heal the state’s wounds.

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Mm. I entrust Dozel’s welfare to you. I pray you’ll be able to lend me your might in the years to come.

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Yes, Lord Seliph!

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Lex’s son, still chatting? C’mon, we should be hurrying!

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Lover? What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Nothing’ll be a sadder sight than having to walk into Dozel while you’re still here. C’mon, you’ll thank me later!

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Heh, I suppose you’re right…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Still busy chatting, Lex’s son? C’mon, we should be going already!

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Lover? What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Is anything quite as sad as going home alone? I guess you should be thanking me for keeping your arm occupied!

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Heh, I suppose you’re right…

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: Are you still chatting, Lex’s son? Shouldn’t we make haste for Dozel?

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Lover? What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Lover
dialogue.line: I’ll be going with you. I’d be too worried if I wasn’t with you…

dialogue.speaker: Lex’S Son
dialogue.line: Ah, right… Thank you, Lover.

narration: At long last, Thracia has been unified. A region once swamped with countless small nations constantly warring among themselves, with the restoration of House Leonster and the downfall of the Thracian kingdom, the Thracian peninsula finally knows peace.
And as the first ruler of this new Thracia, the people ardently desired for the throne to be taken by Leif/Altena.

At Leif’s behest, the old Thracia’s former lands were entrusted to his sister, Altena. Legends tell of Altena’s love for and dedication to the very soil that raised her, and this love never died so long as she lived.
The Thracian peninsula thus gave rise to a new realm: the Kingdom of New Thracia.

The Kingdom of Isaach may have found its freedom from Imperial abuse the quickest, yet its people could not rest easy while its heir was absent fighting in the war. This changed with the final victory of the liberation army, and when (Shannan/Scáthach/Larcei) returned from battle, the people greeted their liege with raucous cheers.

and others by his side to restore the land, they also strove for a new age of diplomacy and trade, seeking to build a wealthy nation. Isaach was once reviled by others as little more than a barbarous eastern land, but under the reign of (Shannan/Scáthach/Larcei), Isaach will grow like never before and shall one day be reborn as a mighty nation, every bit the equal of other realms.

The aftermath of Agustria’s civil war left it to be annexed by Grannvale, and so the land fell to harsh tyranny. After years of abuse, its people dearly wished for the rise of a unified nation, one led by House Nordion, heirs of the legendary hero Eldigan. And so the people eagerly welcomed the homecoming of (Ares/Dermott/Nanna). In (Ares/Dermott/Nanna), the people saw the very same aura Eldigan himself had borne in his youth.
Under the reign of (Ares/Dermott/Nanna), Agustria will soon become Grannvale’s most crucial partner and will grow to be greater than ever before.

Even at its peak, the Empire had shunned and ignored Verdane. Uninterested in seizing the region within its iron fist, it completely abandoned the old kingdom. Instead, Verdane was left to the mercy of constantly warring clans, and brigands ran rampant. Nobody had any hope of peace. Into the fray came (Jamke’s son/Jamke’s daughter), the child and heir of the heroic Prince Jamke, and his wife Jamke’s son’s lover, whose long-awaited return rallied the people’s spirits. Youths flocked to join this new battle. Within a year, the fight for Verdane’s reunification had come to an end, and (Jamke’s son/Jamke’s daughter) took their rightful throne. With the support of Grannvale and Agustria, (Jamke’s son/Jamke’s daughter) worked ceaselessly to rebuild the peaceful Verdane their grandfather, Batur, had once forged. Verdane is a land of natural beauty. Its verdant forests are Sigurd’s prayers… Its sparkling, crystal-clear water is Deirdre’s tears… And these are its people’s emblems of hope and faith…

Silesse had long dwelt under the empire’s cruel hand, and so (Lewyn’s son/daughter/Ced/Hawke/Fee/Femina) devoted their life to rebuilding the ruined land. A breathtaking land… A peaceful people… Lewyn had devoted his life to protecting the Kingdom of Silesse, and at long last, his decades of work had come to fruition.

In the royal capital of Belhalla itself, with overwhelming support from the public, Seliph was officially hailed as their king. The newly anointed King Seliph devoted himself to rebuilding his land and bringing peace to all, his goal nothing short of a prosperous world free of oppression and bigotry. And by his side, one would always find his loving, ever-smiling wife, Queen Seliph’s lover… his sister, Princess Julia, regarding his toil with the warmest of eyes…
In ages to come, the people of Jugdral tell legends of a divine king of ages past. None shall ever forget his name: Seliph.
